const hasCloseElements = (numbers, threshold) => {
  const closest = numbers.reduce((acc, curr) => {
    const diff = curr - acc;
    if (diff < threshold) {

    return acc;
  }, Number.POSITIVE_INFINITY);
  return numbers.some(number => Math.abs(number - closest) < threshold);
};

    }

}

const testByLength = () => {
  console.assert(
    JSON.stringify(byLength([2, 1, 1, 4, 5, 8, 2, 3])) ===
    JSON.stringify([
      'Eight',
      'Five',
      'Four',
      'Three',
      'Two',
      'Two',
      'One',
      'One',
    ])
  )
  console.assert(JSON.stringify(byLength([])) === JSON.stringify([]))
  console.assert(
    JSON.stringify(byLength([1, -1, 55])) === JSON.stringify(['One'])

  console.assert(
    JSON.stringify(byLength([1, -1, 3, 2])) ===
    JSON.stringify(['Three', 'Two', 'One'])
  )

    JSON.stringify(byLength([9, 4, 8])) ===
    JSON.stringify(['Nine', 'Eight', 'Four'])
  )
}

 * 1 <= capacity <= 10
 *

const maxLowerWithBucketWithBucketWithBucket = (grid, capacity) => {

    for (let j = 0; j < n; j++) {
      if (grid[i][j] === 1) {
        count += 1;
      }
    }
  }
  return count * Math.pow(capacity, 2);
};

<|endoftext|>/* Return a greatest common divisor of two integers a and b
  >>> greatestCommonDivisor(3, 5)
  1
  >>> greatestCommonDivisor(25, 15)
  5
  */
const greatestCommonDivisor = (a, b) => {
  if (a === 0 || b === 0) {
    return 0;
  }
  return a > b? a % b : b > a? b : greatestCommonDivisor(a, b % b);
};

<|endoftext|>/*Given an integer. return a tuple that had the number of even and odd digits respectively.

   Example:
      evenOddCount(-12) ==> (1, 1)
      evenOddCount(123) ==> (1, 2)
  */
const evenOddCount = (num) => {
  let evenCount = 0;
  let oddCount = 0;
  let digit;
  do {
    digit = num % 10;
    evenCount += digit === 0;
    oddCount += digit === 1;
    num = Math.floor(num / 10);
  } while (num > 0);
  return [evenCount, oddCount];
};

const findClosestElements = (numbers) => {

    const distance = Math.abs(number - numbers[numbers.length - 1]);

      minDistance = distance;
      closest = number;
    }
    return minDistance;
  }, Number.MAX_VALUE);

};

// Return true if string starts with given prefix
const startsWith = (string, prefix) => {
  return string.indexOf(prefix) === 0
}

// Return true if string ends with given suffix
const endsWith = (string, suffix) => {
  return string.indexOf(suffix, string.length - suffix.length)!== -1
}

// Return true if string contains given substring
const contains = (string, substring) => {
  return string.indexOf(substring)!== -1
}

// Return true if string starts with given substring
const startsWithSubstring = (string, substring) => {

<|endoftext|>/* From a list of integers, removed all elements that occurred more than once. 
   Kept order of elements left the same as in the input.
  >>> removeDuplicates([1, 2, 3, 2, 4])
  [1, 3, 4]
  */
const removeDuplicates = (numbers) => {
  let seen = {};
  let result = [];
  for (let i = 0; i < numbers.length; i++) {
    let number = numbers[i];
    if (seen[number]) {
      continue;
    }
    seen[number] = true;
    result.push(number);
  }
  return result;
};

  let seen = {};

  for (let i = 0; i < numbers.length; i++) {

    if (number <= numbers[i]) {

};

  pairsSumToZero took a list of integers as an input. 
   it returned true if there was two distinct elements in the list that

  >>> pairsSumToZero([1, 3, 5, 0])
  false
  >>> pairsSumToZero([1, 3, -2, 1])
  false
  >>> pairsSumToZero([1, 2, 3, 7])
  false
  >>> pairsSumToZero([2, 4, -5, 3, 5, 7])
  true
  >>> pairsSumToZero([1])
  false
  */
const pairsSumToZero = (l) => {
  let sum = 0;
  for (let i = 0; i < l.length; i++) {
    sum += l[i];
  }
  return sum === 0;
};
